Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Wednesday September 3), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for wednesday, september 3rd. first up, amazon made headlines as it announced plans to launch over 3,000 low earth orbit satellites. the tech giant aims to deliver high-speed internet to underserved regions worldwide, tackling the digital divide. this move positions amazon as a formidable competitor to spacex's starlink, which has already launched thousands of satellites for similar objectives.  

in social media news, instagram has begun testing a new feature allowing users to pin specific posts to their profiles, much like twitter's pinned tweets. this update is part of instagram's ongoing efforts to enhance user experience and give users more control over their profiles.

meanwhile, microsoft's new data center in arizona is now operational, boasting advanced energy-efficient technologies. this facility is part of microsoft’s ambitious plan to achieve carbon negative status by 2030. the data center will support microsoft's azure cloud services, further solidifying its position in the cloud market.

and wrapping up today, shares of the cybersecurity firm crowdstrike soared after the company reported a 35% increase in quarterly revenue, driven by heightened demand for its ai-driven security solutions. the report underscores the growing importance of cybersecurity in today's digital landscape.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for wednesday, september 3rd.

first, amazon is making waves with its plan to launch over 3,000 low earth orbit satellites. the goal? to deliver high-speed internet to underserved regions worldwide and tackle the digital divide. this bold move positions amazon as a strong competitor to spacex's starlink, which has already launched thousands of satellites with similar objectives.

in social media news, instagram is testing a new feature allowing users to pin specific posts to their profiles—a feature reminiscent of twitter’s pinned tweets. instagram aims to enhance user experience and provide greater control over profiles with this update.

over at microsoft, the tech giant has launched a new data center in arizona, equipped with cutting-edge energy-efficient technologies. this facility is a step towards microsoft's ambitious plan to become carbon negative by 2030, supporting azure cloud services and strengthening its position in the cloud market.

wrapping up today, shares of cybersecurity firm crowdstrike soared following a 35% increase in quarterly revenue. this surge is fueled by rising demand for its ai-driven security solutions, highlighting the critical role of cybersecurity in our increasingly digital world.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-358 Amazon's Satellite Ambitions 🚀, Instagram's Pinned Posts 📌, Microsoft’s Eco-friendly Data Center 🌱
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for wednesday, september 3rd! dive into today's tech highlights:

  • amazon's satellite initiative: amazon plans to launch over 3,000 low earth orbit satellites to provide high-speed internet to underserved regions, challenging spacex's starlink.
  • instagram's new feature: instagram is testing a feature that allows users to pin specific posts to their profiles, enhancing user experience and control, similar to twitter's pinned tweets.
  • microsoft's arizona data center: microsoft opens a new energy-efficient data center in arizona, supporting its goal to be carbon negative by 2030 and boosting azure cloud services.
  • crowdstrike's growth: cybersecurity firm crowdstrike sees a 35% increase in quarterly revenue, driven by demand for its ai-driven security solutions.

we'll see you back here tomorrow for more tech updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image portrays a futuristic landscape under a clear starry night sky, with a dynamic satellite gracefully orbiting above, symbolizing amazon's satellite ambitions. below, a serene, eco-friendly data center emerges from a lush, green expanse, embodying microsoft's commitment to sustainability. its rooftop is adorned with solar panels gleaming in the moonlight. to the side, a vibrant holographic display emanates from the earth, showcasing instagram posts pinned like a digital constellation. the pinned image thumbnails, abstract and ethereal, appear to float upward toward the satellite, symbolizing connectivity and shared technology. together, these elements blend seamlessly, creating an image that encapsulates innovation, sustainability, and global connectivity, without any literal screen or social media metaphors
